result.execSummary:
The defendant Shalena D. Messer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA sample

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shalena D. Messer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shalena D. Messer in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:32 a.m. Def would like to proceed with agreement offered by the State. Court asks about victim rights. State had notified victim of offer, but now unable to locate victim. Court will recess for Def to go over paperwork @ 9:36. Back on the record @ 9:47 a.m. Agreement stated, Def will plead to charge, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, court costs. Def agrees. Court reviews waiver of right to atty, charge and possible penalties. Court finds Def has freely & voluntarily waived atty. State has complied with VWNR. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of misd. disorderly conduct. State heard on sentencing. Nothing by Def. Questions and remarks by the Court. Statement by Def. Court will follow agreement. Sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through as required, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. No credit if revoked.

Defendant Shalena D. Messer in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file.  Def indicates that she can not afford an atty.  Court explains court appointed.  Adjournment requested.  Def  wishes to contact the DA to see if agreement reached  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with J. H. or N. M.

Defendant Shalena D. Messer in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:40 p.m. Def would like to get atty, has copy of complaint. Charges and possible penalties reviewed. Atty rights reviewed. State heard on bond. Bond set. Def to report for booking.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
